bioghist.p: Villanova University's College of Nursing Graduate Nursing Program was established in 1980. The focus of the program was the preparation of leaders in nursing education and nursing administration. In 1993, Villanova was the first in the country to offer a designated graduate track in Case Management. Between 1995 and 1998 three new advanced practice tracks were established for nurse practitioners, adult, pediatric and geriatric, and in 1998, the College of Nursing established a track for the preparation of nurse anesthetists. In 1999, the College of Nursing joined forces with the College of Commerce and Finance to develop a joint Health Care Administration track, and in 2004 the College initiated its Ph.D. program.

scopecontent.p: The Graduate Nursing Program records contains syllabi for courses offered to graduate students, 1985-1996; minutes of the Graduate Studies Committee, 1987-1988; and reports and grant materials related to setting up the Graduate Nursing Program, 1970-1982.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
